snippet: Researchers are using extracellular matrix, a natural scaffolding that underlies all tissues and organs, from animals to engineer the growth of replacement tissue like limb muscle lost in injuries.
abstract: Researchers are using extracellular matrix, the natural scaffolding that underlies all tissues and organs, in people as well as animals, to engineer the growth of replacement tissue like limb muscle lost in injuries; for years scientists thought its main role was to hold cells in their proper position but now know this scaffolding also signals the body to grow and repair tissues and organs; technique holds particular promise for some of the thousands of veterans of the Iraq and Afghanistan wars (Series: Body Builders).
lead_paragraph: Researchers are using extracellular matrix, a natural scaffolding that underlies all tissues and organs, from animals to engineer the growth of replacement tissue like limb muscle lost in injuries.

headline.seo: Human Muscle Regenerated With Animal Help
headline.main: Human Muscle, Regrown on Animal Scaffolding
headline.print_headline: Human Muscle, Regrown on Animal Scaffolding
